FuncDef: The display stp command displays the status of and statistics about a spanning tree instance in a Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) process. The display stp command displays the status of and statistics about a spanning tree instance in a Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) process.
CLIs: display stp [ instance <instance-id> ] [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | slot <slot-id> ] [ brief ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the status of and statistics about a spanning tree instance.
If instance <instance-id> is not specified, the status of and statistics about all spanning tree instances will be displayed in the sequence of the interface numbers.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094, Value 0 indicates CIST.

Displays information of a spanning tree on a specified interface.
If interface <ifType> <ifNum> is not specified, the status of and statistics about all interfaces will be displayed in the sequence of the interface numbers.
-

Specifies the number of the slot where the interface resides.
The value is a string of 1 to 23 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo: The display stp command is used to check whether the spanning tree protocol is run on the specified MSTP process.
